text: [Music]
I feel welcome to the AWS enterprise
video series thanks it's really good to
be here
so today we're going to be talking about
culture and the impact of cloud but can
you tell us a little bit about how
companies and organizations around the
world are seeing their culture change
with implementation and deployment of
cloud yeah well you know especially for
enterprises who have really struggled to
adopt new development capabilities that
help them increase the consistency and
pace of delivery as they're using cloud
technologies is also a natural pivot
point for them to go deeper into agile
development and DevOps principles so
that they're able to actually marry that
cloud infrastructure with those internal
process and culture capabilities in
order to speed up the interaction and
feedback loop between product ideas and
and customer interaction so we also hear
that even though the cloud drives a lot
of productivity and there's a lot of
benefits there's also some resistance
and some concerns because of the changes
in culture and the way we've done things
in the past so what are your thoughts in
terms of how to overcome some of these
objections yeah I think initially the
important thing to do is to focus on
communication and training in the
organization communication of what the
intention of the cloud is and benefit
it's intended for as well as what is
going to be expected of the teams as you
make this transition and in fact when
when most organizations build a business
case to move to the cloud at scale they
it's common for us to see productivity
gains in those business cases of 30 to
70 percent that the companies themselves
are forecasting so the the key is
driving that communication of the plan
of team specific roles and how things
will be structured in the organization
as a result of adoption of the cloud
great so from what I'm gathering is that
this is an ongoing process it's not a
you know binary thing that that you flip
a switch and it just happens so what are
some of the best practices and some of
the things that you've learned over your
career that can really help facilitate
that deployment into a cloud culture
world yeah well I mean first is getting
the the team and the and the
organization some exposure to the cloud
what it means to work in that and that
often happens when we see through a
cloud center of excellence which is you
know core group of individuals that are
really cross-functional across security
infrastructure planning and product
development to work on cloud projects
and to make and deliver actual working
functionality for the business used in
the cloud and that's really used as as a
springboard to both train the
organization help build a business case
and also help the organization see the
kind of pace that they'll be operating
at in this new world awesome this is
great really appreciated so are there
any parting thoughts or anything you
would want to leave the audience with
for them to become stewards and change
and adoption of cloud yeah I mean I
think one of the things you see is
companies their their view of the cloud
evolves over time not just their use of
the cloud and to start its looked at
much like a cost and optimization
opportunity sometimes to increase the
pace of innovation and unblock certain
aspects of the business but really as
you move forward and and adopt cloud
native capabilities the business really
starts to change overall because you
change from servers and storage to API
calls that can really be leveraged and
added at a quick pace to adopt new
services and and again delivering more
value more quickly for the business
great thank you so much appreciate it
